metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9577 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was discovered in SPICE before 0.13.90 in the server's protocol handling. An authenticated attacker could send crafted messages to the SPICE server causing a heap overflow leading to a crash or possible code execution.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9577` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libspice-server1 - 0.12.6-4ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: spice package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.12.6-4ubuntu0.2').
